activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trent J Chones

8:42 AM Defendant Trent J Chones in court.  Attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates he has completed the court appointed paperwork and submits it to the court for review/approval. 
BTC: Court appointed attorney granted. Repayment of $100/mo beginning: November 1, 2022. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

State puts offer on the record. 
Court provides court appointed paperwork.
BTC: Matter set over
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's NOI to Intro Recorded Statements
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.G.B (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.

2:53 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trent J Chones in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
